page.title: 03HOUSING IN ALLANTON
page.content: To the south of Chirnside lies the village of Allanton with a population of about 100. Most of the houses in Allanton are privately owned as there are only 4 council houses. A few new bungalows were built in 1980. The houses in Allanton were erected for workers from the Blackadder Estate which employed stonemasons, carpenters, slaters and general labourers to build the houses. Now these houses are nearly all occupied by elderly people but 6 are used as holiday homes. The school closed in the early 1930s. Then alterations were made and it was turned into the village hall. This, combined with the closure of many shops _ there were several tailors _ has resulted in a decline in the population.
